content: My 1 year old loves this app. His physical therapist suggested this app to help him start to use his pointer finger.Had to upgrade because of all the ads, but my son loves this app so it was a small price to pay.

Bubble Bliss XL isn't so much of a game, as it is a "bubble popping simulator" where you tap on bubbles that float up from the bottom of the screen. While they designed it with children in mind, I feel that this app can be enjoyed by anyone at any age who enjoys bubbles. It has beautiful backgrounds, each one with different music that can be enjoyed while you pop the bubbles, or you could simply lay back and enjoy the songs while watching the bubbles float and bump into one another. I love using this app as a way to wind down for the evening. I'm also looking into incorporating the use of this app into my hypnotherapy practice at some point. The only thing I suggest for improvement is to make the bubbles more of a swirly rainbow color (like they are naturally in real life) instead of the somewhat odd window reflection on the sides of them. Thank you for making this wonderful app, I look forward to updates and improvements to it in the future. PS: The link to the music box site in the description does not work anymore. I was so looking forward to seeing what other music he had made. Alas, it is broken.
Good except if its a kids thing there should be no link that says provide feedback that takes the kids out. I know you can do it and it goes away but that is dodging the issue here...

I also don't have the option button to change the theme on tablet for the paid version. Almost worth the dollar to get rid of ads, but I really wanted the extra themes so I don't have to listen to the same music nonstop.
Fake rip off cannot choose themes on xl version. Do not waste your money.

Bought XL version. Works fine on phone. On tablet the menu button in the top right seems to be missing so we're unable to access settings or change background (the menu button is visible on the free play version when played on tablet).

Full version enlarges more on phone screen and there is now way to select options for different backgrounds and themes. Demo version fit on my screen and did allow for this, unsure why full version has a larger aspect ratio.
Totally worth .99 for unlimited bubble popping for little fingers with no worries about accidental add tapping. Several back grounds. Only feature I'd like is a child lock feature.

I felt forced to buy the full version as my girl enjoys it so much, more and more adverts kept appearing on the free one. I cannot get the upgraded version to fit my phone screen size. The original fitted perfectly, but this one doesn't have the right aspect ratio and asks me to use full screen mode which then doesn't display everything as it's then too big for the screen! The original version was perfect before the adverts and the new version is just not properly compatible.
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback. Both apps are based on the same code, so there should be no difference in the screen ratio, but I will definitely look into this.

content: It's good and simple. The single thing I miss is a more complex entrance into menu. Those app usualt require double tap for activation to avoid misclicks.

my 4 month old loves this app. only thing I would like to see change is that the app pins to the page and the taskbar on my samsung tablet would disappear so that he doesnt keep exiting the game accidentally.
replyContent: Thanks for your feedback :) Unfortunately there is no way for an app to disable the taskbar on your device. Some Samsung phones do have a way to lock the navigation bar though. The feature is called Game Tools.

content: Toddlers love this game.  The themes are a nice touch.
